summary: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow distributions from health savings accounts (HSAs) to be used for funeral expenses of the account beneficiary without penalty. It defines funeral expenses broadly to include costs related to burial, cremation, and other related services, up to a $5,000 limit. The bill also clarifies how these expenses are treated in relation to the account beneficiary's death and sets an effective date for the changes.
